DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of pectin, a kind of soluble dietary fiber, on colonic transit time, clinical symptoms and the gut microbiota in adults with slow-transit constipation.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Effects of Soluble Dietary Fiber Supplementation
DOC.detailed_description: Patients were randomized to receive either pectin or placebo. Treatment consisted of 4 weeks supplementation with pectin (fiber group) or placebo. We evaluated the colonic transit time, constipation symptoms and fecal bacterial population in two groups.
